pinyin: ying1 er2 cu4 si3 zong1 he2 zheng4

sentences.english: The type of surgery is the first to be conducted on an infant.
sentences.chinese: 這是首次在初生嬰兒身上進行的同類型手術。

sentences.english: How do you really know what goes into store-bought baby food?
sentences.chinese: 你怎麼真的知道什麼進店買嬰兒食品呢？

sentences.english: Give no artificial teats or pacifiers (also called dummies or soothers) to breastfeeding infants.
sentences.chinese: 對母乳餵養的嬰兒不要使用人工奶嘴或橡皮奶頭。

sentences.english: Flap Horton: Does this mean you won't be knitting the baby any booties?
sentences.chinese: 這不會是意味着你不打算給嬰兒做任何衣服？

sentences.english: After the bath, the baby had nothing on.
sentences.chinese: 洗過澡後，那嬰兒什麼也沒穿。

sentences.english: Most conjoined twins have a very short life-span.
sentences.chinese: 嬰兒大多數都壽命很短。

sentences.english: There was an infant squalling in the back of the church.
sentences.chinese: 有個嬰兒在教堂後部大聲啼哭。

sentences.english: Shujie was asleep in baby carriage, his mother kept watch by side.
sentences.chinese: 舒哲在嬰兒車上熟睡，他的母親守護在車邊。

sentences.english: The married patient hopes to conceive after completing a test tube baby programme.
sentences.chinese: 已婚的德亞希望試管嬰兒項目完成後自己能懷孕。

sentences.english: A more child-friendly liner for the bassinet has been designed.
sentences.chinese: 搖籃曲線設計更加適合嬰兒。

sentences.english: She diverted herself with talking to her baby.
sentences.chinese: 她和她嬰兒說話聊以自娛。

sentences.english: While the five babies were still quietly sleeping in oxygen tents in a hospital nursery.
sentences.chinese: 五個嬰兒在醫院育嬰房的氧氣帳篷裏安睡的時候。

sentences.english: Can I check this stroller at the gate?
sentences.chinese: 我可以在登機門託運嬰兒推車嗎？

sentences.english: referring jaundiced babies for diagnosis and possible treatment;
sentences.chinese: 對有黃疸的嬰兒進行診斷並給予可能的治療。

sentences.english: Community health workers should be aware of the specialized issues around infant feeding.
sentences.chinese: 社區衛生工作者應瞭解有關嬰兒餵養的專門問題。

sentences.english: Toilet and bidet, also with a place to change baby's diapers.
sentences.chinese: 衛生間和洗腳池，還有嬰兒的尿布臺。

definition: to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
